conclusion: Use the relationship between velocity, displacement, and time with velocity inversely proportional to displacement.
Set up the relationship v = k/x where v is velocity, x is displacement, and k is a constant.
Determine the constant k using point B: v_B = 2 m/s, x_B = 2 m, resulting in k = 4.
Find displacement at point A using v_A = 4 m/s, resulting in x_A = 1 m.
Calculate displacement from A to B as 1 m and set up integral for time t.
Evaluate the integral to find time t = 3/8 seconds.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is 3/8 seconds.
